title: Stephen Fry narrates Netflix's Dancing With The Birds from Our Planet creators
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Netflix has revealed the first trailer for new nature documentary Dancing With The Birds, narrated by Stephen Fry.

From the producers of Our Planet narrated by Sir David Attenborough, Netflix has unveiled a new documentary film which spotlights rare birds as they search for a mate.

An official synopsis for the film reads: ‘Settling deep into tropical forests, Dancing With The Birds follows the curiosities of rarely seen birds-of-paradise as they search for a mate in spectacular fashion.

‘From the team that brought us Our Planet and narrated by Emmy Award-winner Stephen Fry, this charming and playful documentary offers an enchanting view of nature at its most wondrous.’

Dancing With The Birds on Netflix (Picture: Netflix)

Judging by the trailer, the documentary appears to have a more playful nature in comparison to Our Planet – seeing an array of birds flap and dance their way to someone’s affections. Just like us.

It appears to be based off a segment from Our Planet which focused on the mating rituals of birds, which proved incredibly popular when it originally aired in April this year.

So an entire film on one of the standout segments from Our Planet? Count us in.

Dancing With The Birds releases 23 October on Netflix.
